Description: Miniature double-vase of rough red siltware pottery, consisting of two linked vases with flat bases and concave sides expanding to the shoulders, then closing to a narrow mouth with everted rims. Both rims are partly broken. The two vases were made separately and then joined by applying a bridge of clay between them at the level of the shoulders.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, Findspot 52, south-eastern quarter of the Saite enclosure (so-called "Camp"), area of ironsmith's workshops.
Curator's comments: The Findspot number 52 has been scratched into the object.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 64 § 61, pl. xxxv, 42)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.108, p.196, pl.38, p.220, pl.62)
